interestingcomments.content: The 501C came this afternoon. I loaded it and took it to the park and shot a roll of film. After that I developed it and currently it is drying in the basement. Later I am going to print a couple of 11x14's to judge the sharpness. So far all is well. I now know why so many Leica owners also have Hasselblads. I think I am really going to like this camera. Thanks again for the suggestions. Oh, I also forgot how nice it is to work with a large negative. Wayne

interestingcomments.content: The 501C came this afternoon. I loaded it and took it to the park and shot a roll of film. After that I developed it and currently it is drying in the basement. Later I am going to print a couple of 11x14's to judge the sharpness. So far all is well. I now know why so many Leica owners also have Hasselblads. I think I am really going to like this camera. Thanks again for the suggestions. Oh, I also forgot how nice it is to work with a large negative. Wayne Please keep in mind that 'infininty' on a and 501 is very far away. I still find it necessary to focus carefully at distant subjects. I will look carefully for such in your photos.
